intro: Cacalia rosea, commonly known as the rose pink or pink bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range from pink to white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Cacalia rosea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
